## Quarto

Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished document. To learn more about Quarto see <https://quarto.org>.

## Running Code

When you click the **Render** button a document will be generated that includes both content and the output of embedded code. You can embed code like this:

```{r}
1 + 1
```

You can add options to executable code like this

```{r}
#| echo: false
2 * 2
```

The `echo: false` option disables the printing of code (only output is displayed).

```{r}
# Load necessary libraries
library(readxl)

# Load the dataset
file_path <- "C:\\Users\\USER\\OneDrive - Institute of Business Administration\\Desktop\\Econometric\\Banks.xlsx"
df <- read_excel(file_path)

# Convert relevant columns to numeric
df$NatlRank <- as.numeric(df$NatlRank)
df$PctDomAssets <- as.numeric(df$PctDomAssets)

# Run the linear regression
model <- lm(NatlRank ~ PctDomAssets, data = df)

# Print the summary of the model
summary(model)


```

```{r}
# Convert relevant columns to numeric
df$NatlRank <- as.numeric(df$NatlRank)
df$DomAssetsMil <- as.numeric(df$DomAssetsMil)

# Run the linear regression
model2 <- lm(NatlRank ~ DomAssetsMil, data = df)

# Print the summary of the model
summary(model2)
```

```{r}
# Load necessary libraries
library(readxl)

# Load the dataset
file_path <- "C:/Users/USER/OneDrive - Institute of Business Administration/Desktop/Econometric/Banks.xlsx"
df <- read_excel(file_path)

# Remove commas and dollar signs from 'DomAssetsMil' before conversion
df$DomAssetsMil <- gsub("[$,]", "", df$DomAssetsMil)
df$DomAssetsMil <- as.numeric(df$DomAssetsMil)

# Remove rows with NA values in DomAssetsMil
df <- df[!is.na(df$DomAssetsMil), ]

# Convert 'NatlRank' to numeric
df$NatlRank <- as.numeric(df$NatlRank)

# Run the linear regression
model2 <- lm(NatlRank ~ DomAssetsMil, data = df)

# Print the summary of the model
summary(model2)

```
